text:
Hi there Nya,
At home I have some old versions of Photoshop and flash, and I really like to draw in Paint Tool SAI which is a Japanese software that it simple but much more affordable than many others and with an amazing brush control. 
This week I was looking into Clip Paint Studio for drawing and animating also because of the brushes and the price. Animation software is usually very expensive for a one-off licence or either there's now this subscription model, which I don't like because you have to pay monthly. Though it might be good professionally if you just need a program for some months to work on something. For storyboarding for my on stuff I use either flash or Storyboard Pro, which I got one licence from a studio I worked for.
Most softwares have discounts for students, sonic your in any kind of education I believe you can get one of those.
I have also tried Krita for drawing and animation, and I liked it a lot, but it wouldn't run smoothly in my pc.
Recently I've seen some great animations made with Fire alpaca, which is another free program.
I hope that helps you!

Hey, Nya, the trailer for the series I'm working on launched yesterday, if you want to take a look at it:
<https://youtu.be/3269NDRLCMo|https://youtu.be/3269NDRLCMo>

text: Their both good, and I recognise the second one
Also yeah I tried Krita as-well, it feels more freeing than what I usually used but did crash I couple of times

Thanks Nya, it's nice to know people's reactions to  the stuff we've been working on :)
Yes, I currently work at blue zoo
This fire alpaca one might be worth looking at. I didn't have the chance to install and try it yet

This girl does some amazing animation with it
